title: Reasoning and Decision Making Lab, University of Waterloo
text: Reasoning and Decision Making Lab is a cognitive psychology lab housed in the Department of Psychology at the University of Waterloo in Canada. I am currently working as a research assistant at the lab. I have/had been a part of the following studies:

title: Reasoning and Decision Making Lab, University of Waterloo
text:
Bet on Yourself (BOY)

Recruited and provided participation credits to participants on SONA (psychology research experiences online platform)
Oriented research participants to the study setting for data collection
Proofread and reviewed the study information before running the experiment

title: Reasoning and Decision Making Lab, University of Waterloo
text:
Thinking in Action (TIA)

Recruited and provided participation credits using SONA
Oriented research participants to the study setting

title: Reasoning and Decision Making Lab, University of Waterloo
text:
Cuing Confidently (CC)

Participated in SONA researcher training
Recruited and provided participation credits using SONA
Oriented research participants to the study setting

title: About
text:
I am a …

Math Enthusiast
“Math enthusiast” is the term I use to describe myself to my students. I hope to transfer my enthusiasm about math to them; I believe my impression of math is transferable and can help students build positive associations with mathematics.


Classical Musician
I am a classically trained musician; I started playing the piano at the age of 4 and the viola at the age of 19. I sometimes perform as a soloist or as a chamber musician. Classical music always makes my life a lot richer and more fulfilling.


Harm-Reduction Worker
I work as a harm-reduction worker at a local shelter in Waterloo, ON. Harm-reduction saves lives!!


Researcher
My research interests include

Designing Accessible K-12 Mathematics Curriculum,
Reasoning & Decision-Making Processes in Mathematical Learning,
Examining the Roles of Self-esteem and Self-efficacy of Students in Learning Mathematics,
Teacher Education: Transferable Impressions of Mathematics, and
Supporting Students with Various Learning Needs in Mathematics Education.

This is not an exhaustive list.


Trans Activist
I am a racialized trans/non-binary person. Supporting and advocating for the trans* community in various ways are essential parts of my life. If you are a queer/trans person and wish to talk more about navigating your school/work safely as a queer/trans person, please feel free to reach me.

title: Social Development Lab, University of Waterloo
text: Social Development Lab is a developmental psychology lab housed in the Department of Psychology at the University of Waterloo in Canada. I am currently working as a research assistant at the lab. These are some projects I have been part of:

title: Social Development Lab, University of Waterloo
text:
Validation of WRBS-Middle
The Waterloo Region Belonging Survey - Middle Childhood Version (WRBS-Middle) is designed to measure children’s (aged 8-13) sense of belonging in non-school contexts. As a directed studies student, I lead the validation of the survey by

Examining the internal consistency, validity, and factor structure of the WRBS-Middle
Writing a formal report on the validation processes and results

title: Min Max Seo
text: Welcome to my website. My name is Min (they/them) and I am a graduate student in the Faculty of Education at Ontario Tech University. You can find links to my email address and CV below.

title: Social Development Lab, University of Waterloo
text:
Data Cleaning of WRBS-Early
The Waterloo Region Belonging Survey - Early Childhood Version (WRBS-Early) is designed to measure children’s (aged 3-7) sense of belonging in non-school contexts. As a research assistant, I am in charge of

Cleaning and merging children’s data with their parents’ data using R

title: Faculty of Education, Wilfrid Laurier University
text: I have been working as a research assistant of Dr. Jennifer Holm at WLU. Project(s) I have been part of:

title: Faculty of Education, Wilfrid Laurier University
text:
Teachers’ Use of mathematics Apps
This is a qualitative study aimed to examine teachers’ experiences using math apps in their classrooms.

Conducted a literature search and drafted an informal report of the results
Participated in research design meetings
